chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
E2: R -> Prop
E1: R -> Prop
l: Rbar

Goal:
(forall x : R, E2 x -> E1 x) -> is_lb_Rbar E1 l -> is_lb_Rbar E2 l

Premises:
is_lb_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : R, E x -> Rbar_le l x : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
*** [ R : Set ]
is_ub_Rbar_subset : forall (E1 E2 : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), (forall x : R, E2 x -> E1 x) -> is_ub_Rbar E1 l -> is_ub_Rbar E2 l
is_lb_Rbar_dec : forall E : R -> Prop, {l : R | is_lb_Rbar E l} + {forall l : R, ~ is_lb_Rbar E l}
is_ub_Rbar_opp : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_lb_Rbar E l < -> is_ub_Rbar (fun x : R => E (- x)) (Rbar_opp l)
is_lb_Rbar_opp : forall (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar), is_ub_Rbar E l < -> is_lb_Rbar (fun x : R => E (- x)) (Rbar_opp l)
is_ub_Rbar = fun (E : R -> Prop) (l : Rbar) => forall x : R, E x -> Rbar_le x l : (R -> Prop) -> Rbar -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope _]
is_ub_Rbar_dec : forall E : R -> Prop, {l : R | is_ub_Rbar E l} + {forall l : R, ~ is_ub_Rbar E l}
infinite_sum = fun (s : nat -> R) (l : R) => forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> R_dist (sum_f_R0 s n) l < eps : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
completeness : forall E : R -> Prop, bound E -> (exists x : R, E x) -> {m : R | is_lub E m}
RField_lemma5 : forall (l : list R) (l1 : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)), (forall lock : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z) -> Prop, lock = PCond 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq IZR N.to_nat pow l -> lock (Fapp (Fcons2 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem) l1 Datatypes.nil)) -> PCond 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq IZR N.to_nat pow l l1
is_lub = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => is_upper_bound E m /\ (forall b : R, is_upper_bound E b -> m <= b) : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
PCond : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> Prop) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> Prop
display_pow_linear : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
Rbar_rec : forall P : Rbar -> Set, (forall r : R, P r) -> P p_infty -> P m_infty -> forall r : Rbar, P r
Rbar_rect : forall P : Rbar -> Type, (forall r : R, P r) -> P p_infty -> P m_infty -> forall r : Rbar, P r
Rbar_ind : forall P : Rbar -> Prop, (forall r : R, P r) -> P p_infty -> P m_infty -> forall r : Rbar, P r
sumbool_rec : forall (A B : Prop) (P : {A} + {B} -> Set), (forall a : A, P (left a)) -> (forall b : B, P (right b)) -> forall s : {A} + {B}, P s
is_upper_bound = fun (E : R -> Prop) (m : R) => forall x : R, E x -> x <= m : (R -> Prop) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
*** [ Rmult : R -> R -> R ] Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
*** [ Rplus : R -> R -> R ] Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
bound = fun E : R -> Prop => exists m : R, is_upper_bound E m : (R -> Prop) -> Prop Argument scope is [function_scope]
Rmin_case_strong : forall (r1 r2 : R) (P : R -> Type), (r1 <= r2 -> P r1) -> (r2 <= r1 -> P r2) -> P (Rmin r1 r2)
*** [ Rlt : R -> R -> Prop ] Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
R_dist = fun x y : R => Rabs (x - y) : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rmin_case : forall (r1 r2 : R) (P : R -> Type), P r1 -> P r2 -> P (Rmin r1 r2)
Rminus = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 + - r2 : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rdiv = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 * / r2 : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rgt = fun r1 r2 : R => r2 < r1 : R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
sqrt_square : forall x : R, 0 <= x -> sqrt (x * x) = x
Rbar_inv_opp : forall x : Rbar, x <> 0 -> Rbar_inv (Rbar_opp x) = Rbar_opp (Rbar_inv x)
Rbar_lt_locally : forall (a b : Rbar) (x : R), Rbar_lt a x -> Rbar_lt x b -> exists delta : posreal, forall y : R, Rabs (y - x) < delta -> Rbar_lt a y /\ Rbar_lt y b
RField_field_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (l : list R), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq IZR N.to_nat pow l lpe ->...-> FEeval 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp Rdiv Rinv IZR N.to_nat pow l fe = display_pow_linear 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp Rdiv 0%Z 1%Z Zeq_bool IZR N.to_nat pow get_signZ l (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem n lmp (num nfe)) (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem n lmp (denum nfe))
RField_field_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list R) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (fe1 fe2 : FExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq IZR N.to_nat pow l lpe -> forall lmp : list (Z * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol Z), Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem lpe = lmp -> forall nfe1 : linear Z, Fnorm 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool fe1 = nfe1 ->...-> FEeval 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp Rdiv Rinv IZR N.to_nat pow l fe1 = FEeval 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp Rdiv Rinv IZR N.to_nat pow l fe2
Rmin = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then x else y : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Rmax = fun x y : R => if Rle_dec x y then y else x : R -> R -> R Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Fcons2 : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C)
Ring_polynom.norm_subst : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> nat -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C) -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C
Rle = fun r1 r2 : R => r1 < r2 \/ r1 = r2 : R -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [R_scope R_scope]
Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list : forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C -> C) -> (C -> C) -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> C -> C * C) -> list (Ring_polynom.PExpr C * Ring_polynom.PExpr C) -> list (C * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol C)
Ring_polynom.Peq : forall C : Type, (C -> C -> bool) -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> bool
ex_Rbar_mult_opp_l : forall x y : Rbar, ex_Rbar_mult x y -> ex_Rbar_mult (Rbar_opp x) y

```coq
intros H1 H2. unfold is_lb_Rbar. intros H3 x H4. apply H1. apply H3. apply H2. apply H4.
Qed.```
